instructions: In a large pot, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned
Drain excess fat
Add onion, garlic, carrot, and celery
Cook until vegetables are tender
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper
Simmer for 30 minutes
Meanwhile, cook spaghetti according to package instructions
Drain
Serve Bolognese sauce over cooked spaghetti and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese
In a large bowl, combine romaine lettuce, croutons, and Parmesan cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together Caesar dressing, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the lettuce mixture and toss to coat evenly.
Serve immediately as a side dish or add grilled chicken for a complete meal.

ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced
instructions: In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add bell pepper, onion, broccoli, snap peas, and garlic. Stir-fry for a few minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, sesame oil, salt, and pepper. Pour the sauce into the skillet with the vegetables.
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and stir-fry for an additional minute to coat everything in the sauce.
Serve the chicken stir-fry over cooked rice.
Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating them.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle balsamic glaze and olive oil over the salad.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately as a refreshing appetizer or side dish.
In a large pot, bring chicken broth to a boil. Add chicken breasts, carrots, celery, onion, garlic, bay leaf, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Remove the chicken from the pot and shred it using two forks. Return the shredded chicken to the pot.
Add egg noodles to the pot and cook according to package instructions until tender.
Discard the bay leaf. Adjust the seasoning if needed.
Serve the chicken noodle soup hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
Place the cumin, black peppers, cinnamon, cardamom and cloves in a dry pan
Roast over low heat until warmed through and fragrant and blend (I used a coffee grinder) until smooth
You need just 1 to 11/2 tablespoons for this recipe (depending on how fragrant you want the rice to be)
Feel free to store the leftover spice powder in an airtight container for up to 3 months, or refrigerate for up to 6 months
